intro: Artanthe seemanniana, commonly known as the Emu Bush, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy addition to native gardens. Artanthe seemanniana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to local wildlife.
